TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE criminal proceedings were brought against Š. who was suspected of fraud . On DATE the applicant ’s wife joined the proceedings with a claim for damages .
The main hearing scheduled for DATE had to be adjourned as the accused person had failed to appear .
The accused was remanded in custody on DATE . On DATE he admitted before the Košice II District Court judge that he owed the sum in question to the applicant ’s wife .
Hearings in the criminal case were held on DATE as well as on DATE and DATE . In the meantime , on DATE , the accused was released from detention on remand .
On DATE the case was adjourned as the assessors were absent .

DATE and DATE ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings . The accused failed to appear at the last QUANTITY hearings . At these hearings the case was not proceeded with for various reasons , mainly due to the absence of an assessor but also because of the absence of witnesses .

In the meantime criminal proceedings were brought against NORP before the ORG for similar offences imputed to him and another person . On DATE ORG decided that all charges against NORP and the other person should be determined by the ORG in a single set of proceedings .
On DATE the case was adjourned .
On DATE the applicant ’s wife died . The heirs concluded an agreement according to which her estate passed to the applicant .
On DATE the case was adjourned as the other accused had not appeared . On DATE the accused was remanded in custody , but ORG ordered his release on DATE .
Neither accused person appeared before the Košice II ORG on DATE . ORG therefore issued warrants which were submitted to the police on DATE respectively .

CARDINAL of the accused persons was brought by the police to a hearing scheduled for DATE . The police was unable to establish the whereabouts of ORG , the other accused , who had earlier admitted that he owed a sum to the applicant ’s wife . ORG decided to deal with the charges against NORP separately . It returned the case concerning the other accused to the public prosecutor .
On DATE the applicant confirmed to ORG that , as heir of his late wife , he maintained the above claim for damages .
On DATE the president of the PERSON I ORG informed ORG that the accused ORG had not yet been remanded . The letter stated that it was for the police to establish the whereabouts of that accused .
The proceedings are pending .

The applicant complained to ORG that the ORG had violated his right under Article CARDINAL ) of the LAW to a hearing without unjustified delay in the criminal proceedings in which the above claim for damages was to be determined .
On DATE the ORG delivered a finding concluding that there had been no violation of Article CARDINAL ) of the LAW .

ORG first held , with reference to the ORG ’s caselaw under LAW , that the guarantees of Article CARDINAL ) of the LAW were applicable as the applicant ’s civil right to compensation was to be determined in the context of criminal proceedings against Š.

As to the merits of the case , ORG held that there had been CARDINAL significant delay of DATE in the proceedings , namely during the period DATE and DATE . It further held that the proceedings had also been unduly delayed as a result of repeated adjournments of the case DATE . As to the period subsequent to CARDINAL DATE , ORG found no delays in the proceedings which could be imputed to ORG . In particular , ORG had been unable to proceed with the case effectively as the accused had not been arrested pursuant to the warrant issued in DATE , and the responsibility for arresting the accused lay with the police . ORG explicitly noted that the applicant himself had not included that period among the unjustified delays for which he held ORG responsible . ORG found that the applicant had not contributed to the length of the proceedings . Despite the above delays imputable to ORG , the overall length of the proceedings was principally due to the complexity of the case .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Act CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . ) , a petition for proceedings to be brought before the Constitutional Court shall indicate , inter alia , the party against whom it is directed and the decision which the plaintiff seeks to obtain .
With the exception of cases where the LAW otherwise provides , ORG is bound by a petition for proceedings to be brought before it ( paragraph CARDINAL of section CARDINAL ) .
